It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Manager of the McClung Historical Collection, 500 West Church Avenue, Knoxville, TN, 37902-2505. (865) 215-8801.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1835 May 5, Talladega, [Alabama] [to] J. Grantham & C[harles] F. Welcker / Richard Grantham
bibl.author: Grantham, Richard
bibl.note: The following document is a letter dated May 5, 1835, written by Richard Grantham to Jonathan Grantham and Charles F. Welcker in Talladega, Alabama. Richard requests some iron be sent to him for his blacksmith shop.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: sir I want some Iron We are entirely out and it is Badly needed, Tucker and myself are puting up a Blacksmith shop and we Want a quanty of Iron, and all the Shops are out here I Bot Col. Couls. Bacon and has Sold out Bacon will do well. Flour is verry fast at Ten dollars, send Some Iron by the first Waggon that halls for us I have sold Bacon at 12½ cts
all is well. Show this to Welcker Carson is in a powerful pet about his Iron for that horse Send all you Can for you Cant keep me Supplied
